page.title: 17THE OLDEST INHABITANT
page.content: MRS. PARTON IS OVER 90. SHE HAS LIVED IN RODINGTON FOR 55 YEARS. SHE STILL ENJOYS LIVING HERE ALTHOUGH THE VILLAGE HAS GROWN A LOT. THERE WERE MOSTLY SMALL COTTAGES WITH THE PEOPLE LIVING IN THEM WORKING ON THE LAND. THERE WERE NO COUNCIL HOUSES, MOST OF THE SMALL COTTAGES BELONGED TO THE ESTATE. EVERYBODY USED TO KNOW EVERY- BODY ELSE, BUT NOW NEW HOUSES HAVE BEEN BUILT AND SHE DOESNT KNOW SO MANY PEOPLE. NOT SO MANY WORK ON THE LAND NOW. THERE IS ONE PRIVATE HOUSE WHERE 6 SMALL-HOLDINGS USED TO BE. MACHINERY HAS TAKEN OVER. THE LOCAL FARMER USED TO EMPLOY 21 MEN BUT NOW ONLY 4. VERY FEW OF THE PEOPLE WHO LIVE IN THE VILLAGE ACTUALLY WORK THERE. MRS. PARTON CAN REMEMBER WHEN THERE WAS A BLACKSMITH, WHEELWRIGHT,UNDERTAKER AND BAKER.THE CHILDREN USED TO BRING ROUND THE BUNS, HOT FROM THE OVEN,AT EASTER.
